title.narrative: Chad COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Project

description.narrative: The purpose of the COVID-19 Strategic Preparedness and Response Project in Chad is to prevent, detect and respond to the threat posed by COVID-19 (Coronavirus)and strengthen national systems for public health preparedness. This project consists of three components. The first component will support the country's ability to promote an integrated preparedness and response to COVID-19(Coronavirus) through improved prevention measures, laboratory capacity and surveillance, case detection and contact tracing, case management and treatment. It consists of the following subcomponents:(i)COVID-19 Prevention and Preparedness Planning; (ii) Improving Case Detection, Confirmation, Contact Tracing, Recording and Reporting; (iii) Improving Case Management of COVID-19 Patients, and; (iv) Food and basic supplies to households and patients. The second component is Community Engagement and Social and Behavior Change Communication. This component will support the development and testing of Social and Behavior Change(SBC) messages and materials to raise awareness, knowledge and understanding among the general population about the risk and potential impact of the pandemic and to promote prevention measures, including hand-washing, hygiene and social distancing. The third component is Implementation Management, Monitoring and Evaluation and Coordination. This component will finance operational costs of the Project Coordination Unit (PCU). These include equipment, additional staff and other operational expenses needed to implement the project.
